meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sordid or disreputable.
meanings.sent1: The seediness of the abandoned building was evident from the broken windows and graffiti-covered walls.
meanings.sent2: The seediness of the neighborhood made her feel unsafe walking alone at night.
meanings.sent3: Despite its seediness, the old diner had the best pancakes in town.
meanings.sent4: The seediness of the situation reminded him of a crime movie he once watched.
meanings.sent5: The seediness of the alley was like a dark cloud hanging over the city.

meanings.definition: The condition of being run-down or shabby.
meanings.sent1: The seediness of the motel was apparent from the peeling paint and broken furniture.
meanings.sent2: She decided to renovate the house to get rid of its seediness.
meanings.sent3: The seediness of the old car made it look like a vintage treasure.
meanings.sent4: The seediness of the park was a stark contrast to the vibrant city life around it.
meanings.sent5: The seediness of the abandoned factory gave it a haunting aura.
